title: Victims of Bernie Madoff Ponzi scheme to get $1 million
text:
Many of the victims who lost everything in Bernie Madoff's Ponzi scheme will finally be getting some payback.
According to Steve Harbeck, president and CEO of the Securities Investors Protection Corporation, anyone who invested up to $1,161,000 with Madoff will "be made completely whole."
The majority of those receiving the roughly $1 million refund in the new motion were Madoff victims. And for those who invested more money with Madoff, they could get back at least 61 cents on the dollars for their investments if their claim has been approved, Harbeck said. He called it a "major victory."
U.S. officials have recovered $11 billion of the $17 billion believed to have been lost when Madoff's Ponzi scheme collapsed in 2008. A majority of the money recovered has come from the bank accounts of Jeffrey Picower, now deceased, an alleged co-conspirator. His widow agreed to turn over the $7.2 billion Picower made in the scheme to the victims, which is more than Madoff himself made, officials said.
